workflow.name: Automate invoice processing & stock management with AI, Gmail, Sheets & Slack
workflow.description:
## ‚úÖ What problem does this workflow solve?

Order processing often involves manual invoice reading, stock checking, and back-and-forth communication between procurement and operations teams. This workflow automates the **entire procurement decision flow** ‚Äî from reading incoming order emails to extracting structured data, checking stock, and creating either a purchase requisition or a work order automatically.

---

## üí° Main Use Cases

- üì• Auto-extract order and invoice details from incoming emails  
- üì¶ Validate stock availability before processing orders  
- üìù Auto-create **Purchase Requisitions** when stock is insufficient  
- üõ† Auto-create **Work Orders** when stock is available  
- üìß Notify procurement or operations via email & Slack  
- üìä Log every action in Google Sheets for tracking and audit  

---

## üß† How It Works ‚Äì Step-by-Step

### 1. üìß Gmail Trigger  
The workflow begins when a new email arrives at a specific email address.  
The invoice file is automatically downloaded for processing.

---

### 2. üìë Extract Invoice Record  
The attached invoice is processed using OCR or a document extraction tool.  
Raw details such as:
- Order ID  
- Item code  
- Quantity  
- Customer information  

are extracted for further processing.

---

### 3. ü§ñ AI-Powered Data Structuring  
OpenAI structures the extracted fields into a clean and consistent format:  
- `order_id`  
- `item_code`  
- `quantity`  
- `customer_name`  

This ensures all data is normalised before stock validation.

---

### 4. üì¶ Stock Check  
The workflow checks inventory data stored in **Google Sheets**.  
It compares:
- Required quantity  
- Current stock  

If stock is **insufficient**, it triggers the purchase requisition path.  
If stock is **available**, it initiates the work order path.

---

### 5. üîÄ Conditional Flow

#### **If stock is insufficient:**  
- Creates a **Purchase Requisition** record in Google Sheets  
- Sends an **email notification** to the procurement team for approval  

#### **If stock is sufficient:**  
- Creates a **Work Order** entry in Google Sheets  
- Sends a **Slack summary message** to the operations team  

This ensures teams are notified instantly, and work continues without delays.

---

## üìä Logging & Reporting  
Every step ‚Äî extracted data, PR created, WO created, notifications sent ‚Äî is logged in Google Sheets.  
This provides a full audit trail for procurement and operations teams.

---

## üë§ Who can use this?

Ideal for:
- Procurement teams  
- Operations departments  
- Manufacturing & warehouse units  
- Businesses processing high-volume emailed orders  
- Any team needing structured, automated order workflows  

---

## üöÄ Benefits

- ‚è± Faster order processing  
- üß† Fewer manual errors from invoice reading  
- üì¶ Smarter procurement decisions based on real stock  
- üîÅ Automated communication loops  
- üìä Transparent audit logs for every order  

---

parameters.subject: =Purchase Requisition Request ‚Äì {{ $json['item name'] }} / {{ $json['SKU / Item Code'] }}

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow automates order procurement by monitoring Gmail for invoice PDFs. When an invoice arrives, AI extracts order details and checks inventory levels. If stock is sufficient, a work order is created and sent to Slack. If stock is low, a purchase requisition is generated and emailed to procurement.

## Setup steps
1. **Connect Gmail** ‚Äì Add OAuth credentials to Gmail Trigger and Send nodes
2. **Connect OpenAI** ‚Äì Add API key to OpenAI Chat Model
3. **Connect Google Sheets** ‚Äì Add OAuth credentials and update the spreadsheet ID in all Google Sheets nodes (or use the sample sheet linked below)
4. **Connect Slack** ‚Äì Add access token and select your channel
5. **Update email addresses** ‚Äì Set sender filter in Gmail Trigger and recipient in Send a message node
6. **Test** ‚Äì Send a sample invoice PDF to trigger the workflow

üìä Sample Sheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X_iuREMFdiefIF_ukCwTBUMXGURwR1mC-RMl1hztssw

## Invoice Processing
Extracts order data from PDF attachments using AI to structure customer info, SKU, quantity, and pricing.

## Check stock availability or not
- If available, then create a work order and notify via Slack.
- In not available, then create a Purchase Requisition and send an email to the procurement team.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
